# arithmetic_mean { #dumbpy.arithmetic_mean }

`arithmetic_mean`

dumbpy.arithmetic_mean
======================

Compute the arithmetic mean of numeric values.

The input may be a nested iterable; nesting is flattened via
:func:`dumbpy.support_functions.validate_list`.

## Functions

| Name | Description |
| --- | --- |
| [arithmetic_mean](#dumbpy.arithmetic_mean.arithmetic_mean) | Compute the arithmetic mean of numeric values. |

### arithmetic_mean { #dumbpy.arithmetic_mean.arithmetic_mean }

```python
arithmetic_mean.arithmetic_mean(values)
```

Compute the arithmetic mean of numeric values.

#### Parameters {.doc-section .doc-section-parameters}

| Name   | Type            | Description                                             | Default    |
|--------|-----------------|---------------------------------------------------------|------------|
| values | Iterable\[Any\] | A (possibly nested) iterable containing numeric values. | _required_ |

#### Returns {.doc-section .doc-section-returns}

| Name   | Type   | Description                                |
|--------|--------|--------------------------------------------|
|        | float  | The arithmetic mean of the numeric values. |

#### Raises {.doc-section .doc-section-raises}

| Name   | Type       | Description                                                                                                              |
|--------|------------|--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|        | ValueError | If the flattened input contains no elements.                                                                             |
|        | TypeError  | If the input is not a valid iterable for flattening, or if any element is non-numeric (raised by :func:`validate_list`). |

#### Examples {.doc-section .doc-section-examples}

```python
>>> arithmetic_mean([1, 2, 3, 4])
2.5
>>> arithmetic_mean([1, [2, 3]])
2.0
```
